title: Hawkwind - Croydon Fairfield Halls Rooms 25th March 2001
description:
The Venue:
----------

Fairfield Halls, Croydon, 25th March 2001.

Rating:
-------

8.5/10

The Band:
---------
Dave Brock
Ron Tree
Jerry Richards
Keith Kniveton
Simon House
Captain Rizz
Alan Davey
Jez Huggett
Huw Lloyd Langon
Richard Chadwick

The Set:
--------
01 Intro
02 Assault & Battery
03 The Golden Void
04 Clouded Vision
05 Money Tree
06 Space Is Deep
07 Hippy
08 Flying Doctor
09 Owl And The Pussycat
10 Angels Of Death
11 High Rise
12 Intro
13 The Awakening
14 Warriors
15 You&#039;d Better Believe It
16 The Gremlin
17 Spirit Of The Age
18 Hassan-I-Sahba
19 Spiral Galaxy
20 Motorway City
21 Hurry On Sundown

This comes from a double CDR that I had, with no venue information, only the title "Spiral Galaxy" and a track list. This is why there are two tracks called "Intro" - one from the beginning of CD1, the other from CD2.  

From Starfarer&#039;s gig list, I&#039;m positive it&#039;s Fairfield Halls, Croydon, 25th March 2001.

A month or so back I found I couldn&#039;t play CD1, so I figured the CDR was damaged.  Using EAC I extracted it all to WAV to see what I could salvage.  Turned out aside from some jumps on the first "Intro" track, and a momentary blip about 12 seconds into "Awakening", it&#039;s fine.

So I encoded it to VBR MP3 using RazorLame 115.

It&#039;s not a bad gig at all.  The stereo separation is good, and the vocals are very prominent. Bass & Drums tend to take over a bit, probably due to the auto recording level of the tape-recorder,but overall I&#039;d give it an 8.5/10.  There&#039;s a lot of good-natured banter between songs, indicating the band are enjoying themselves here, and personally I think it&#039;s a cracking version of "Motorway City"!
